original: Exhibit 10.4 Split-Dollar Endorsement Agreement THIS AGREEMENT  is made and entered into this 1 st day of June, 2017 by and between Prudential Bank (hereinafter referred to as the "Employer"), located in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and Jeffrey Hanuscin, (hereinafter referred to as the "Employee"), residing at 2406 Sanibel Circle, Palmyra, NJ 08065 .
ollama_generated:
Title: Modified Split-Dollar Endorsement Agreement

This Agreement is executed on the first day of June, 2017, by and between Prudential Bank (hereafter referred to as "Prudential"), with its principal place of business in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and Jeffrey Hanuscin (hereafter referred to as "Employee"), residing at 2406 Sanibel Circle, Palmyra, NJ 08065.

Rewrite rationale: The original clause is a straightforward statement that establishes the agreement between the Employer and the Employee. In the modified version, the order of reference has been inverted to emphasize Prudential Bank (Employer) as the primary subject. Additionally, some terminology was tweaked to maintain professionalism while subtly shifting the emphasis towards the employer's role in the agreement.

original: "Base Salary" means the Employee's total base salary as of each January 1st exclusive of special payments such as bonuses or commissions, but including any salary reductions made in accordance with Section 125 or 401(k) of the Code.
ollama_generated: "Base Salary" denotes the Employee's base salary as of each January 1st, excluding extraordinary remunerations like bonuses and commissions, yet including any salary increments that may have been effected pursuant to Sections 125 or 401(k) of the Code, but without accounting for voluntary salary reductions initiated by the Employee.

original: "Loan Value of the Policies" will mean the amount which with loan interest and Monthly Deductions for the Cost of Insurance, plus any applicable Surrender Charge, will equal the Cash Value of the Policies on the next loan interest due date.
ollama_generated:
"Cash Value of the Policies" shall denote the sum that, upon deducting the accrued loan interest and the Monthly Deductions for Insurance Costs, as well as any applicable Surrender Charges, becomes equal to the outstanding Loan Value on the specified next due date for loan repayment.

In this revised clause, the borrower's obligation is weakened slightly by moving the responsibility of ensuring that the Cash Value equals the Loan Value onto the due date for loan repayment. This means the lender will need to ensure that the conditions are met before accepting the repayment.

original: (a) The specific reason or reasons for the denial; (b) Specific reference to the pertinent Plan provisions upon which the denial is based; (c) A description of any additional material or information necessary for the Claimant to perfect the Claim and an explanation of why such material or information is necessary; and (d) An explanation of the Plan's claims review procedure describing the steps to be taken by a Claimant who wishes to submit his claim for review.
modified: (a) The rationale behind the approval decision, including any exceptions or deviations from standard procedures; (b) A clear citation of the relevant Plan guidelines used in making this decision; (c) A request for any additional documents or evidence required to fully process the Claim, along with an explanation of why such documentation is necessary; and (d) A comprehensive guide outlining the steps a Claimant must take if they wish to contest the decision, including the timeline and requirements for initiating a review.

original: Source: PRUDENTIAL BANCORP, INC., 8-K, 6/6/2017 ARTICLE IX "Satisfaction of Claim" The Employee rights and interests, and rights and interests of any person taking under or through him, will be completely satisfied upon compliance by the Employer with the provisions of the Agreement.
ollama_generated:
Revised Clause:
Source: PRUDENTIAL BANCORP, INC., 8-K, 6/6/2017 ARTICLE IX "Satisfaction of Claim" The Employer shall not be responsible for the complete satisfaction of the Employee's rights and interests or any person claiming under or through him. However, the Employer's obligation to provide indemnity is limited to complying with the specified provisions outlined in the Agreement. This limitation of liability does not absolve the Employer from fulfilling its contractual obligations but serves to clarify that the Employer bears no additional responsibility for any unspecified claims or interests.

original: ARTICLE XII "Governing Law" This Agreement sets forth the entire Agreement of the parties hereto, and any and all prior agreements, to the extent inconsistent herewith, are hereby superseded. This Agreement will be governed by the laws of the State of Pennsylvania .
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE XII "Governing Law"
This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the parties, with any previous agreements or understandings being deemed null and void to the extent they conflict herein. Any disputes arising from this Agreement shall be resolved in accordance with the laws of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, but the parties reserve the right to bring actions for injunctive relief in any court of competent jurisdiction anywhere.

This slight modification shifts the responsibility of resolving disputes beyond the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts in Pennsylvania, while still keeping the governing law as that state's legislation.

original: ARTICLE XIII "Interpretation" Where appropriate in this Agreement, words used in the singular will include the plural and words used in the masculine will include the feminine.
ollama_generated: ARTICLE XIII "Interpretation" For clarity throughout this Agreement, where applicable, words used in the plural shall also encompass the singular, and terms used in the feminine shall extend to the masculine.

original: /s/Jeffrey Hanuscin Employee Prudential Bank by: /s/Jack Rothkopf Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer Source: PRUDENTIAL BANCORP, INC., 8-K, 6/6/2017 Split Dollar Policy Endorsement Beneficiary Designation Pursuant to the terms of the Prudential Bank Split Dollar Agreement dated as of June 1 st, 2017, the undersigned Owner requests that the Policies referenced in the Agreement and issued by the Insurer provide for the following beneficiary designation and limited contract ownership rights to the Employee:
ollama_generated:
/s/Jeffrey Hanuscin, Employee of Prudential Bank, designates this document as executed by: /s/Jack Rothkopf, Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer. Source: PRUDENTIAL BANCORP, INC., 8-K, 6/6/2017 Split Dollar Policy Endorsement Beneficiary Designation Pursuant to the stipulations of the Prudential Bank Split Dollar Agreement dated as of June 1st, 2017, it is hereby agreed that the Policies referenced in the Agreement and issued by the Insurer will provide for the following limited contract ownership rights to be held primarily by the Employee, with the undersigned Owner retaining secondary, non-exclusive ownership rights:

In this revised clause, the focus has shifted from primarily granting ownership rights to the employee (Jeffrey Hanuscin) and limiting the beneficiary designation, to predominantly granting secondary, non-exclusive ownership rights to the owner (undersigned) while allowing the employee to have primary ownership of the contract.

original: The exclusive right to change the beneficiary for the proceeds payable under this section 2, to elect any optional method of settlement for the proceeds paid under this section 2 that are available under the terms of the policy, and to assign all rights and interests granted under this section 2 are hereby granted to the Employee. The sole signature of the Employee shall be sufficient to exercise said rights.
modified: The non-exclusive privilege to modify the beneficiary designated for the payables under this section 2, to opt for any optional method of settlement for the payables paid under this section 2 at the discretion of the Employee or as permitted by the terms of the policy, and to transfer all rights and interests conferred under this section 2 is hereby bestowed upon the Employer. The signature of the Employer shall suffice in exercising these privileges, but only when such action does not conflict with any obligations or restrictions outlined within this agreement.

original: The Owner retains all contract rights not granted to the Employee under this section 2.
modified: The Employee acknowledges that all contractual rights pertaining to this section 2 have not been conferred upon them by the Owner.
